items.message: River levels remain high but are now falling at the Lugwardine river gauge. Flooding of roads and farmland continues. We expect flooding to affect low lying land and roads adjacent to the River Lugg south of Leominster from Stoke Prior to Mordiford. Other locations that may be affected include Bodenham, Lugwardine and Hampton Bishop. No significant rainfall is forecast over the next 48 hours. We expect river levels to remain high until Tuesday 08/03/22. We are closely monitoring the situation. Please avoid using low lying footpaths near local watercourses and avoid contact with flood water. This message will be updated by 9am on Tuesday 08/03/22, or as the situation changes.

Property flooding is not currently expected. River levels are high on the River Thame following rainfall last week. Flooding of roads and farmland is expected to continue especially close to the river around Stadhampton. No rain is forecast today (Monday 7th) or overnight. River levels are slowly decreasing however we expect them to remain high over the next couple of days. We are closely monitoring the situation. Please remain safe and aware of your local surroundings and refer to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river levels. This message will be updated this evening unless the situation changes.

items.description: Hundred Foot Washes in Cambridgeshire and Norfolk

floodArea.riverOrSea: Old Bedford River, New Bedford River, Hundred Foot Drain, River Delph

items.message: River levels remain high but steady at the Sutton Gault river gauge, and river levels are slowly rising at the Welney Causeway river gauge following recent rainfall. Consequently, flooding of roads and farmland is possible today, Monday 07/03/2022. We expect flooding to affect the Hundred Foot Washes, also known as the Ouse Washes. No further rainfall is forecast. We expect river levels to remain high throughout Monday, 07/03/2022. This information is correct as of 07:40 on Monday 07 March. The causeway at Sutton Gault has approximately 19 centimetres of water on the road. The causeway at Welney has approximately 3 centimetres of water on the road. There are currently no issues on the Earith causeway. Due to uneven surface of the road, water may be deeper in places. Please avoid using low lying footpaths near local watercourses and plan driving routes to avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded. This message will be updated by 16:00 this afternoon, 07/03/22, or as the situation changes.

River levels remain high but steady at the Sutton Gault river gauge following recent rainfall. Consequently, flooding of roads and farmland is possible today, Monday 07/03/2022. We expect flooding to affect The Causeway at Sutton Gault. No further rainfall is forecast. We expect river levels to remain high throughout Monday, 07/03/2022. This information is correct as of 07:40 on Monday 07 March. The causeway at Sutton Gault has approximately 19 centimetres of water on the road. Due to uneven surface of the road, water may be deeper in places. The Environment Agency are liaising with Cambridgeshire Highways, who will decide whether to close the road. This alert applies to SUTTON GAULT CAUSEWAY ONLY. Please avoid using low lying footpaths near local watercourses and plan driving routes to avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded. This message will be updated by 16:00 this afternoon, 07/03/2022, or as the situation changes.

River levels are slowly rising at the Welney Causeway river gauge following recent rainfall.  Consequently, flooding of roads and farmland is possible today, Monday 07/03/2022.  We expect flooding to affect the A1101 Wash Road at Welney.   No further rainfall is forecast.  We expect river levels to remain high throughout today, Monday 07/03/22. This information is correct as of 07:40 on Monday 07 March. The causeway at Welney has approximately 3 centimetres of water on the road. Due to uneven surface of the roads, water may be deeper in places. The Environment Agency are liaising with Norfolk Highways, who will decide whether to close the road. This alert applies to WELNEY CAUSEWAY ONLY. 
Please plan driving routes to avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded.  This message will be updated by 16:00 this afternoon, 07/03/2022, or as the situation changes.

This Flood Alert has been removed.  The risk of flooding from the Severn Estuary has now reduced.  There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain.  We continue to monitor the situation.  Our incident response staff are checking the condition of defences.

items.message:
This Flood Alert has been removed.  
River levels have now fallen below the flood risk threshold.  We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue this alert if necessary.  No further significant rainfall is forecast over the next 48 hours.  
We continue to monitor the situation.  Our incident response staff are checking the condition of defences.  
Please avoid contact with flood water.

This Flood Alert has been removed. River levels have now fallen below the flood risk threshold. We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue this alert if necessary. No further rainfall is forecast. We continue to monitor the situation. Please see the GOV.UK website for a 5-day flood forecast.

Please avoid using low lying footpaths near local watercourses.

items.description: River Trent from Cromwell Weir to Gainsborough
items.message:
This Flood Alert has been removed.  
River and high tide levels have now fallen below the flood risk threshold.  
We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue this alert if necessary.  
Please see the GOV.UK website for a 5 day flood forecast.

Flooding is no longer expected. 
River levels are forecast to rise on the River Thames as a result of high tides at 6:00 pm today (06/03/22) and 6:15 am tomorrow, but flooding of low lying land on Trowlock Island is no longer expected.
We are closely monitoring the situation and will reissue this alert if necessary. Please remain safe and aware of your local surroundings and refer to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river level information.

floodArea.county: Bracknell Forest, Surrey, Windsor and Maidenhead

items.message:
River levels on the Chertsey Bourne remain high but are continuing to fall slowly and the river is flowing within its banks. There may still be standing water in the floodplain in some low lying areas adjacent to the river. We will continue to monitor the weather forecast and will reissue this alert if necessary, but further flooding isn’t currently expected.
Please remain safe and aware of your local surroundings and refer to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river level information.
